member.name: M:BlogEngine.Core.Providers.BlogProvider.FillRights
member.summary: Returns a dictionary representing rights and the roles that allow them.
member.returns:
The key must be a string of the name of the Rights enum of the represented Right. The value must be an IEnumerable of strings that includes only the role names of roles the right represents.
Inheritors do not need to worry about verifying that the keys and values are valid. This is handled in the Right class.

member.name: T:BlogEngine.Core.BusinessBase`2
member.summary: This is the base class from which most business objects will be derived. To create a business object, inherit from this class.
member.typeparam: The type of the derived class.
The type of the Id property.

member.name: F:BlogEngine.Core.BusinessBase`2.brokenRules
member.summary: The broken rules.
member.remarks:
This has been updated from using the old StringDictionary class from .Net 1.1. The StringDictionary class used case-insensitive keys, so this one needs to have StringComparer.OrdinalIgnoreCase passed in the constructor for backwards compatibility.
INotifyPropertyChanging is implemented in case down the line someone wants to create a provider that uses BusinessBase objects as Linq-To-SQL entities(DataContext performance skyrockets when this is used).

member.name: P:BlogEngine.Core.BusinessBase`2.Disposed
member.summary:
Gets a value indicating whether the object has been disposed.
If the objects is disposed, it must not be disposed a second time. The Disposed property is set the first time the object is disposed. If the Disposed property is true, then the Dispose() method will not dispose again. This help not to prolong the object's life if the Garbage Collector.
member.value: true if this instance is disposed; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:BlogEngine.Core.Compilation.ReflectExpressionBuilder
member.summary: Implements an expression builder that provides a strongly-typed reference to a type or member info, instead of a string. Targeted properties still receive a string as input, but the expression is validated during page compilation or execution. If the supplied expression cannot be resolved to a type or member info from an assembly loaded into the current domain then an exception is thrown. Note that type and member name resolution is case-sensitive. Only public types and members can be resolved.
member.remarks: <add expressionPrefix="Reflect" type="WebApp.Compilation.ReflectExpressionBuilder, WebApp"/> Add the above to the web.config. The following examples illustrate the usage of the expression in web pages: <asp:ObjectDataSource SelectMethod="<%$ Reflect: ComCard.Components.BusinessObjects.Task, Search %>" ... /> This will resolve the type ComCard.Components.BusinessObjects.Task, and validate that Search is a public member on that type. The member name will be returned for binding to the property. <asp:ObjectDataSource DataObjectTypeName="<%$ Reflect: ComCard.Components.BusinessObjects.LogEntry %>" ... /> This will resolve the type ComCard.Components.BusinessObjects.LogEntry. The type name will be returned for binding.

member.name: M:BlogEngine.Core.Compilation.ReflectExpressionBuilder.EvaluateExpression(System.Object,System.Web.UI.BoundPropertyEntry,System.Object,System.Web.Compilation.ExpressionBuilderContext)
member.summary: Evaluates the expression at runtime.
member.param: The entry for the property bound to the expression.
member.returns: A string representing the target type or member.

member.name: M:BlogEngine.Core.Compilation.ReflectExpressionBuilder.GetCodeExpression(System.Web.UI.BoundPropertyEntry,System.Object,System.Web.Compilation.ExpressionBuilderContext)
member.summary: Returns a expression for invoking the expression from a compiled page at runtime.
member.param: The entry for the bound property.

member.name: M:BlogEngine.Core.Compilation.ReflectExpressionBuilder.ParseExpression(System.String,System.Type,System.Web.Compilation.ExpressionBuilderContext)
member.summary: Parses and validates the expression data and returns a canonical type or member name, or throws an exception if the expression is invalid.
member.param: Contextual information for the expression builder.
member.returns: A string representing the target type or member name for binding.

member.name: M:BlogEngine.Core.Compilation.ReflectExpressionBuilder.ValidateExpression(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Validates that the specified type and member name can be resolved in the current context. Member name resolution is optional.
member.param: The full name of the type.
The member name to resolve, or null to ignore.
member.returns: The type / member name as a string for binding to the target property.

member.name: P:BlogEngine.Core.Compilation.ReflectExpressionBuilder.SupportsEvaluate
member.summary: Gets a flag that indicates whether the expression builder supports no-compile evaluation. Returns true, as the target type can be validated at runtime as well.

member.name: P:BlogEngine.Core.BlogSettings.AllowServerToDownloadRemoteFiles
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this application's handlers should be able to download and cache files hosted on other servers.
member.remarks:
Allowing the server's various handlers(Such as JavaScriptHandler and CssHandler) could potentially allow a an attacker to tie up the server by continuously requesting files of excess file size, or from servers that take forever to time out.
This is false by default.

member.name: P:BlogEngine.Core.BlogSettings.RemoteFileDownloadTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum length of time in milliseconds the server should spend downloading remote files. The default value is 30000.
member.remarks: If the limit is set to something below 0, the defaultRemoteDownloadTimeout will be used instead. 0 is an acceptable value, users should use this value to indicate "unlimited time".

member.name: P:BlogEngine.Core.BlogSettings.RemoteMaxFileSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowed file size in bytes that BlogEngine can download from a remote server. Defaults to 512k.
member.remarks: Set this value to 0 for unlimited file size.

member.summary: Evaluates an expression string and provides the design-time value for a control property.
member.param: An expression string to evaluate. The expression does not include the expression prefix.
An object containing additional parsing information for evaluating . This typically is provided by the expression builder.
The type of the control property to which is bound.
A service provider implementation supplied by the designer host, used to obtain additional design-time services.
member.returns: The object referenced by the evaluated expression string, if the expression evaluation succeeded; otherwise, null.

member.name: T:BlogEngine.Core.Web.Scripting.JavascriptMinifier
member.summary: Helper class for performing minification of Javascript and CSS.
member.remarks:
This class is basically a wrapper for the AjaxMin library(lib/AjaxMin.dll). http://ajaxmin.codeplex.com/
There are no symbols that come with the AjaxMin dll, so this class gives a bit of intellisense help for basic control. AjaxMin is a pretty dense library with lots of different settings, so everyone's encouraged to use it directly if they want to.

member.name: M:BlogEngine.Core.Web.Scripting.JavascriptMinifier.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new Minifier instance.

member.summary: Builds the required CodeSettings class needed for the Ajax Minifier.

member.name: M:BlogEngine.Core.Web.Scripting.JavascriptMinifier.Minify(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the minified version of the passed in script.

member.name: P:BlogEngine.Core.Web.Scripting.JavascriptMinifier.VariableMinification
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this Minifier instance should minify local-scoped variables.
member.remarks: Setting this value to LocalVariablesAndFunctionArguments can have a negative impact on some scripts. Ex: A pre-minified jQuery will fail if passed through this.

member.name: P:BlogEngine.Core.Web.Scripting.JavascriptMinifier.PreserveFunctionNames
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this Minifier instance should preserve function names when minifying a script.
member.remarks: Scripts that have external scripts relying on their functions should leave this set to true.

member.name: P:BlogEngine.Core.Web.Scripting.JavascriptMinifier.RemoveWhitespace
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the instance should remove whitespace from a script.

member.name: T:BlogEngine.Core.Web.Scripting.VariableMinification
member.summary: Represents the way variables should be minified by a Minifier instance.

member.name: F:BlogEngine.Core.Web.Scripting.VariableMinification.None
member.summary: No minification will take place.

member.name: F:BlogEngine.Core.Web.Scripting.VariableMinification.LocalVariablesOnly
member.summary: Only variables that are local in scope to a function will be minified.

member.name: F:BlogEngine.Core.Web.Scripting.VariableMinification.LocalVariablesAndFunctionArguments
member.summary: Local scope variables will be minified, as will function parameter names. This can have a negative impact on some scripts, so test if you use it!

member.summary: Gets a sorted collection of all undeleted posts across all blogs. Sorted by date.

member.name: P:BlogEngine.Core.Post.ApplicablePosts
member.summary: Gets a sorted collection of all undeleted posts, taking into account the current blog instance's Site Aggregation status in determining if posts from just the current instance or all instances should be returned. Sorted by date.
member.remarks: This logic could be put into the normal 'Posts' property, however there are times when a Site Aggregation blog instance may just need its own posts. So ApplicablePosts can be called when data across all blog instances may be needed, and Posts can be called when data for just the current blog instance is needed.

member.name: T:BlogEngine.Core.Rights
member.summary: Enum that represents rights or permissions that are used through out BlogEngine.
member.remarks:
Each Rights enum value is wrapped by an associated Right instance that contains information about roles/descriptions/etc.
When a Rights value is serialized to persistant storage, the enum's string name should be used in order to prevent conflicts with value changes due to new values being added(either through updates or customization).
Also, at the moment this doesn't nearly represent all the current possible actions. This is just a few test values to play with.
I'd recommend using a common word pattern when used. Ie: Create/Edit/Delete/Publish as prefixes. The names should be very specific to what they allow in order to avoid confusion. For example, don't use a name like "ViewPosts". Use something that also specifies the kinds of posts, like ViewPublicPosts, ViewPrivatePosts, or ViewUnpublishedPosts.

member.name: F:BlogEngine.Core.Rights.None
member.summary: Represents a user that has no rights or permissions. This flag should not be used in combination with any other flag.
member.remarks: This value isn't meant for public consumption.

member.name: F:BlogEngine.Core.Rights.ViewDetailedErrorMessages
member.summary: A user is allowed to view exception messages.

member.name: F:BlogEngine.Core.Rights.AccessAdminPages
member.summary: A user is allowed to access administration pages. Typically, a blog where self-registration is allowed would restrict this right from guest users.

member.name: F:BlogEngine.Core.Rights.AccessAdminSettingsPages
member.summary: A user is allowed to access admin settings pages.

member.name: M:BlogEngine.Core.Right.AddRole(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a role to the list of roles that have this Right.
member.returns: True if the role doesn't already exist in the list of roles. Otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Use this method specifically to add roles to the internal list. This lets us keep track of what's added to it.

member.name: M:BlogEngine.Core.Right.RemoveRole(System.String)
member.summary: Removes a Role from the collection of roles that allow this Right.
member.returns: Returns true if the role was removed, false otherwise.
member.remarks: Use this method specifically to remove roles from the internal list. This lets us keep track of what's removed from it.

member.name: M:BlogEngine.Core.Right.ClearRoles
member.summary: Clears all the roles in the roles list. This is only meant to be used during the static RefreshAllRoles method.

member.name: P:BlogEngine.Core.Right.Flag
member.summary: Gets the Right value for this Right instance.

member.name: P:BlogEngine.Core.Right.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of this right.
member.remarks:
This returns the string name of the Flag enum that this instance represents.
This value should be the one that's serialized to the provider's data store as it's far less likely to change than the numerical value.

member.name: P:BlogEngine.Core.Right.Roles
member.summary: Gets the Roles that currently have this Right.
member.remarks: This returns a read only wrapper around the internal roles list. The Roles list is not allowed to be altered anywhere. Changes to the list need to go through the proper channels.

member.name: P:BlogEngine.Core.Category.ApplicableCategories
member.summary: Gets a sorted list of all Categories, taking into account the current blog instance's Site Aggregation status in determining if categories from just the current instance or all instances should be returned.
member.remarks: This logic could be put into the normal 'Categories' property, however there are times when a Site Aggregation blog instance may just need its own categories. So ApplicableCategories can be called when data across all blog instances may be needed, and Categories can be called when data for just the current blog instance is needed.

member.name: F:BlogEngine.Core.Blog._InstanceIdOverride
member.summary:
Marked as ThreadStatic so each thread has its own value. Need to be careful with this since when using ThreadPool.QueueUserWorkItem, after a thread is used, it is returned to the thread pool and any ThreadStatic values (such as this field) are not cleared, they will persist.
This value is reset in WwwSubdomainModule.BeginRequest.

member.name: T:BlogEngine.Core.RemoteFile
member.summary: Class used to download files from a website address.
member.remarks:
The purpose of this class is so there's one core way of downloading remote files with urls that are from outside users. There's various areas in BlogEngine where an attacker could supply an external url to the server and tie up resources.
For example, the JavascriptHandler accepts off-server addresses as a path. An attacker could, for instance, pass the url to a file that's a few gigs in size, causing the server to get out-of-memory exceptions or some other errors. An attacker could also use this same method to use one BlogEngine instance to hammer another site by, again, passing an off-server address of the victims site to the JavascriptHandler.
RemoteFile makes use of two BlogSettings properties: AllowServerToDownloadRemoteFiles and RemoteFileDownloadTimeout.
This class will not throw an exception if the Uri supplied points to a resource local to the running BlogEngine instance.
There shouldn't be any security issues there, as the internal WebRequest instance is still calling it remotely. Any local files that shouldn't be accessed by this won't be allowed by the remote call.

member.name: M:BlogEngine.Core.RemoteFile.#ctor(System.Uri,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new RemoteFile instance that can be used to download files from another server.
member.param: The url of the file to be downloaded.
Set to true if RemoteFile should ignore the current BlogEngine instance's remote download settings.

member.name: M:BlogEngine.Core.RemoteFile.GetWebResponse
member.summary: Returns the WebResponse used to download this file.
member.remarks: This method is meant for outside users who need specific access to the WebResponse this class generates. They're responsible for disposing of it.

member.name: M:BlogEngine.Core.RemoteFile.GetFileAsString
member.summary: Returns the remote file as a string.
member.remarks: This returns the resulting stream as a string as passed through a StreamReader.

member.name: M:BlogEngine.Core.RemoteFile.GetWebRequest
member.summary: Creates the WebRequest object used internally for this RemoteFile instance.
member.returns: The WebRequest should not be passed outside of this instance, as it will allow tampering. Anyone that needs more fine control over the downloading process should probably be using the WebRequest class on its own.

member.name: P:BlogEngine.Core.RemoteFile.IgnoreRemoteDownloadSettings
member.summary: Gets whether this RemoteFile instance is ignoring remote download rules set in the current BlogSettings instance.
member.remarks: This should only be set to true if the supplied url is a verified resource. Use at your own risk.

member.name: P:BlogEngine.Core.RemoteFile.UriPointsToLocalResource
member.summary: Gets whether the Uri property is pointed at a resource local to the running BlogEngine instance.
member.remarks: This property is to determine whether the remote path supplied is pointing to a local file instance. This check is required because when a user has CompressWebResource set to true, it sends js.axd the full site path as its query parameter.

member.name: P:BlogEngine.Core.RemoteFile.Uri
member.summary: Gets the Uri of the remote file being downloaded.

member.name: P:BlogEngine.Core.RemoteFile.TimeoutLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of time, in milliseconds, that a remote file download attempt can last before timing out.
member.remarks:
This value can only be set if the instance is supposed to ignore the remote download settings set in the current BlogSettings instance.
Set this value to 0 if there should be no timeout.

member.name: P:BlogEngine.Core.Security.CurrentUser
member.summary: Gets the current user for the current HttpContext.
member.remarks: This should always return HttpContext.Current.User. That value and Thread.CurrentPrincipal can't be guaranteed to always be the same value, as they can be set independently from one another. Looking through the .Net source, the System.Web.Security.Roles class also returns the HttpContext's User.

member.summary: Returns a dictionary representing rights and the roles that allow them.
member.returns:
The key must be a string of the name of the Rights enum of the represented Right. The value must be an IEnumerable of strings that includes only the role names of roles the right represents.
Inheritors do not need to worry about verifying that the keys and values are valid. This is handled in the Right class.
